name: 顏炳郎
objective: The purpose of the course is to introduce why a feedback control is used to improve the stability and performance. Then the course elaborate how to design a feedback controller, how to analyze a feedback control system in discrete time domain. Laboratory of implementing a digital controller to a mechatronic system will also be included.
schedule:
Schedule:
1. Review of continuous time control system
2. Introduction of discrete time system
3. Analysis of discrete time systems
4. Discrete time controller Design
   (i) Traditional Controller: PID, Lead-Lag
   (ii) Pole-placement design: a state space approach
   (iii) Optimal Controller Design: LQ, LQG (Kalman filter), LQG/LTR
   (iv) Robust Controller (H∞ and Phase stabilized compensator), 
   (v) Disturbance Observer
   (vi) Adaptive Controller: System Parameter Identification and Self-Tuning
5. Implementation of digital controllers: Sampling time selection, Quantization
scorePolicy:
Homework 50%
Midterm exam 30%
Final Experiment (Digital controller implementation) 20%
